meanings.definition: To load (a gun) with fresh ammunition.
meanings.sent1: After shooting, he was reloading his gun for the next round.
meanings.sent2: The soldier was reloading his rifle during the battle.
meanings.sent3: The cowboy kept reloading his revolver as if in a never-ending duel.
meanings.sent4: She felt like she was reloading her determination with each new challenge.
meanings.sent5: The sound of reloading echoed through the shooting range.

meanings.definition: To refresh or renew (supplies, energy, etc.).
meanings.sent1: She was reloading her energy by taking a short nap.
meanings.sent2: The hiker stopped to sit and reloading his water supply.
meanings.sent3: After a long day at work, he felt like reloading his patience.
meanings.sent4: The vacation was a way of reloading their spirits for the upcoming challenges.
meanings.sent5: The weekend getaway was a perfect way of reloading their enthusiasm.

meanings.definition: To load (a webpage, document, etc.) again.
meanings.sent1: The slow internet connection made him reload the webpage multiple times.
meanings.sent2: She was reloading the document to check for any new updates.
meanings.sent3: He kept reloading the page, hoping for a different result each time.
meanings.sent4: The student was reloading the online quiz to see the corrected answers.
meanings.sent5: The constant reloading of the website was frustrating for the users.
